Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades

Blades hold state and a set of operations which are performed on that state.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Blade
    A blade is an object with state operated on by requests within the thread context of a single reactor.
    BlockingBlade
    Blocking blades are used to perform I/O or long computations.
    IsolationBlade
    An isolation blade does not process a request until the response for the previous request is returned.
    NamedBlade
    A blade with a name.
    NonBlockingBlade
    When the messages passed to a non-blocking blade are processed, control must be returned quickly, without excessive computation and without blocking the thread.
    SwingBoundBlade
    A swing-bound blade processes the requests and responses that it receives on the swing UI thread.
    ThreadBoundBlade
    All the requests and responses of a thread-bound blade are processed on the single thread to which the reactor is bound.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BladeBase
    Optional base class for blades.
    BlockingBladeBase
    A blocking blade performs long computations, I/O or otherwise may block the thread.
    IsolationBladeBase
    An isolation blade does not process a request until the response for the previous request is returned.
    NonBlockingBladeBase
    A blades which does not perform long computations nor otherwise block the thread.
    SwingBoundBladeBase
    A swing-bound blade processes the requests and responses that it receives on the swing UI thread.
    ThreadBoundBladeBase
    All the requests and responses of a thread-bound blade are processed on the single thread to which the reactor is bound.

Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades Description

Blades hold state and a set of operations which are performed on that state. A blade is initialized when it has been assigned a reactor. (Any number of blades can share the same reactor.)

BladeBase provides a number of useful methods, but is not required for an object to be a blade.

There are a number of specialized blades, depending on the type of reactor they use. On the other hand, NamedBlade is a blade that has a name and can be registered with a facility.
